messages.messageBody:
A neighbor told me a horror story of her iguana
stalking her son....And attacking!!

DS2's girlfriend has and iguana, she says no problems.
The cats (she has lots) leave it alone!!

Sharon of the Swamp

messages.subject: Re: Pets...was Re: [AlwaysLearning] DC Tomorrow
messages.msgSnippet: ... Just not in the same cage ;-) vbg We had, at one point, three dogs, one cat, one bird, and one snake.  Now we simply have 2 dogs, a collie cross we just
messages.messageBody:
Kate Green wrote:

>
> I think snakes and rats are great pets for
> kids

Just not in the same cage ;-) vbg

We had, at one point, three dogs, one cat,
one bird, and one snake. Now we simply have
2 dogs, a collie cross we just got in
Janurary (she was a rescue dog, beautiful and
sweet, but too damn smart for her own good,
she can clear our 6 foot fence with out even
touching it! We have long talks about the
garden which has a 2 foot fence--we call it
the dog deterent, and I'm just hoping she's
smart enough to realize it's meaning). Our
other dog is a 13 year old malamute/shepard
cross, who I picked up when he was about 6
weeks old. We had hampsters but they have
gone onto hampster heaven. I'd like to get a
fish tank but have no where to put it!

joylyn

> and hey snakes don't do the
> allergic thing either -- although we also
> have never had any problems with
> allergies in our house. The only pet I
> would hesitate against again would
> be a large iguana. We had one who was about
> 3 foot long and extremely mean.
> She looked like a little dinosaur and we
> were all afraid of her:(
>
> Kate

messages.subject: Re: Pets...was Re: [AlwaysLearning] DC Tomorrow
messages.msgSnippet: ... pollen. ... We only have one dog, one cat, a tortoise, and a squirrel right now but that s because we are living in an apartment. Grandma has our other dog
messages.messageBody:
> We're looking into snakes at the moment. What is a good snake for beginners?
> ATM we have 2 dogs, 3 cats, 10 guinea-pigs and some fish. I'd like some rats
> too but DH says we have enough mouths to feed :-(
> And the weird thing is, so many people in North Virginia are allergic to
> animals. In the UK I never met one person who had any allergies except
pollen.
> the people here are just sick all the time :-(
>
> Shyrley

We only have one dog, one cat, a tortoise, and a squirrel right now but
that's because we are living in an apartment. Grandma has our other dog (a
border collie ---THE best breed:) other cat and snake (a boa constrictor
called Monty). But we have had almost every kind of pet you can think of
(love ferrets).
I think snakes and rats are great pets for kids and hey snakes don't do the
allergic thing either -- although we also have never had any problems with
allergies in our house. The only pet I would hesitate against again would
be a large iguana. We had one who was about 3 foot long and extremely mean.
She looked like a little dinosaur and we were all afraid of her:(

Kate

messages.subject: Pets...was Re: [AlwaysLearning] DC Tomorrow
messages.msgSnippet: ... We re looking into snakes at the moment. What is a good snake for beginners? ATM we have 2 dogs, 3 cats, 10 guinea-pigs and some fish. I d like some rats
messages.messageBody:
Nancy Wooton wrote:

> on 4/3/02 4:12 PM, Scott P. Cook at scottcook@... wrote:
>
> > I'll introduce myself, belatedly.
> > I live in Burke and have 4 kids and WAY too many pets.
>
> OK, what do you consider WAY too many pets?
>
> We have 2 dogs, 1 cat, 1 rat, 1 leopard gecko, 1 kingsnake, 1 parakeet, 2
> fish, and up until last night, 1 mouse (now resting in peace with 3 ex-rats
> in a consecrated corner of the yard). Oh, and I work with horses 3 days a
> week but none of them live with us.
>
> (The house is about 1,000 sq ft. but we have a decent sized suburban lot.)
>
> Nancy, in San Diego with 2 kids, one dh, and many pets. I'll be one of
> those eccentric 90-year-old ladies who keeps pet snakes.
>

We're looking into snakes at the moment. What is a good snake for beginners?
ATM we have 2 dogs, 3 cats, 10 guinea-pigs and some fish. I'd like some rats
too but DH says we have enough mouths to feed :-(
And the weird thing is, so many people in North Virginia are allergic to
animals. In the UK I never met one person who had any allergies except pollen.
the people here are just sick all the time :-(

Shyrley
